entry.label: 0 - Unknown
1 - The prospect is simply exploring the market
2 - A vague executive mandate without a clear target date
3 - A specific initiative within the business with a general timeframe
4 - A specific initiative within the business with a target date and consequences for missing the date
5 - A product or service that is critical to the business operations
0 - Unknown
1 - It is not clear how the solution will be validated or purchased
2 - Quite a bit of ambiguity in the buying process and decision criteria are present
3 - The buying process and decision criteria are becoming clearer but ambiguity still is present
4 - The prospect has clearly articulated the buying process and decision criteria
5 - The prospect has clearly articulated the buying process, decision criteria, and a mutual action plan has been created
0 - Unknown
1 - No identified impact that can be tied to revenue, cost or risk
2 - Slight cost savings possible
3 - Soft cost savings exist
4 - Marginal hard cost savings or revenue growth can be predicted
5 - Significant revenue growth or cost savings can be predicted
0 - Unknown
1 - No identified pain
2 - Identified low-level latent pain, prospect works around the nuisance
3 - Identified latent pain, prospect works around the pain today
4 - Identified pain, prospect’s business is being impacted by the pain
5 - Identified acute pain, prospect’s business is being impacted by the pain
0 - Unknown
1 - Not in our ICP
2 - In our ICP
3 - In our ICP, right market conditions
4 - In our ICP, right market conditions, right timing
5 - In our ICP, right market conditions, exceptionally right timing

skuid__text.contents: Click the button to add your SPICED score for this opportunity. Use this to evaluate the opportunity and quickly see where the gaps are.

SPICED is a Winning by Design framework that helps diagnose customers. It organizes information to make sure you know why and when a customer will commit to your solution and achieve impact. Use SPICED for handoffs between teams (e.g., prospecting to sales or sales to customer success) or to summarize a deal during forecasting or cross-functional meetings.

S (Situation): Facts or circumstances relevant to customer’s world. Defines tools, people, industry, and company landscape to understand opportunity size and customer fit

P (Pain): Problems customer wants solution to solve. Defines acute challenges and frustrations, such as issues with process or desired improvements in workflow

I (Impact): Results produced by solving pain. Impact reveals business goals you could address, e.g., increase revenue, decrease cost, improve customer experience; impact can be emotional (individual level) or rational (company level)

CE (Critical Event): Any deadline by which customer must achieve impact or suffer consequences. Critical Events drive timeline for purchase.

D (Decision): Customer's decision process and criteria. Map the buying committee decision process based on who needs to be involved by stage, who will sign, who needs to approve, etc.
(Situation x 2) + (Pain x 2) + (Impact x 10) + (Critical Event x 2) + (Decision x 4)

enableConditions.message: Please save or cancel changes first

actionsequence.label: Update Sliders with Score Values and reset pagination
Update or create new record on Save
actionsequence.description: This checks to see if the record has been modified today. If it has been modified today, the changes will update the record. If the record has been modified before today, a new record will be created and the existing record will be captured for historical reporting/analytics purposes.

actionsequence.label: Update Score Progress Indicator
actionsequence.description: Takes the score for each SPICED value and then updates a UI Only field with the corresponding number. This allows the "slider" to reflect the appropriate score at all time. This is built due to the fact that you can't have a Formula field in edit mode and therefore, you couldn't have a slider.

actionsequence.label: Check for deal in page param

action.label: If there's deal id in the page param
